Detailed Description

represents the polynomial as a linked list of terms

void Polynomial::insert ( term *  t  ) 

add a term to the list

insert : add to list & reduce insert is in degree order polynomial is maintained in sorted order reduce only combines like terms.

Definition at line 61 of file poly.cc.

00061                                {
00062   term * u = polynomial;
00063   term * prev = NULL;
00064   while(u->next && ( t->deg > u->deg)){
00065     prev = u;
00066     u = u->next;
00067   }
00068   if (u == polynomial && !(t->deg >= u->deg)){
00069     //still at head of list, and t is not bigger
00070     polynomial = t;
00071     t->next = u;
00072   }  else if (t->deg > u->deg){
00073     // got to end of list
00074     u->next = t;
00075   }
00076   else {
00077     // in the middle
00078     t->next = u;;
00079     if(prev)
00080       prev->next = t;
00081     else polynomial = t;
00082   }
00083   reduce();
00084   return;
00085 }

multiplication operator

Definition at line 154 of file poly.cc.

00154                                {
00155   // for each term in rhs
00156   // multiply terms by coef and raise power by deg
00157   Polynomial p;
00158   term * u;
00159   term * t = rhs.polynomial;
00160   while (t) {
00161     u = polynomial;
00162     while(u){
00163       p.insert(u->coef * t->coef, u->deg + t->deg);
00164       u = u->next;
00165     }
00166     t = t->next;
00167   }
00168   return p;
00169 }

double Polynomial::operator() ( double  a  )  const

polynomial evaluation at a point a

evaluate at point a

Definition at line 117 of file poly.cc.

References polynomial.

00118 {
00119   Polynomial p;
00120   term *t, *u;
00121   unsigned degree;
00122   double result = 0;
00123   // first reverse order the list
00124   // since the polynomial is sorted,
00125   // just peel off to the front each time.
00126   t = polynomial;
00127   while (t){
00128     u =  p.polynomial;
00129     p.polynomial = new term(*t);
00130     t = t->next;
00131     p.polynomial->next = u;
00132   }
00133   // seed with the highest order term
00134   t = p.polynomial;
00135   degree = t->deg;
00136   // now evaluate the polynomial at a
00137   while(t){
00138     // multiply result by a
00139     while(degree > t->deg){
00140       result *= a;
00141       degree--;
00142     }
00143     // add next coefficient
00144     result += t->coef;
00145     //remember depth (there might be gaps)
00146     degree = t->deg;
00147     // advance
00148     t = t->next;
00149   }
00150   return result;
00151 }

Polynomial Polynomial::antiderivative (  )  const

general antiderivative with no arbitrary constant. Really, the arbitrary constant is zero here. by ignoring the constant we lose any meaningful result from antiderivative(0) which would have been a constant, but chooses 0 hence applying twice to 0, which would have been an arbitrary constant times x + another arbitrary constant, gives 0 for both constants, and looks like 0 again

Definition at line 230 of file poly.cc.

00234     if(t->deg == 0)
00235       p.insert(t->coef, 1);
00236     else
00237       p.insert( t->coef /(1.0+ t->deg), t->deg+1);
00238     t=t->next;
00239   }
00240   return p;
00241 }
